name: QuickiesWithSDL
short_description:
I wanted one central repository where I could move the abundance of one-night projects that fill up that old harddrive, I rescued from my 12 year old laptop.

The plan is to migrate them to SDL2 and try to turn the more interesting ones into coding katas and/or tutorials. I'm working on this in my spare spare time, so it might take forever.

This is just for fun and, at the moment, for personal reference only. However, if you find anything useful or interesting amongst the old junk, I'd really appreciate it, if you would drop me a note in the forum/discussion. Maybe that could motivate me to work on this more frequently ;-)
summary: Katas, Samples and Tests with SDL
